location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 5/7 Mohammad Ali Nasir alias Sayed Ahmad, Egyptian'

physicalDescription.extent: Foliation: The foliation sequence runs from the front to back cover, is circled and in pencil.

mods.abstract: This file contains correspondence between Captain George Leslie Mallam, acting British Political Agent at Bahrain and Lieutenant Colonel Francis Beville Prideaux, British Political Resident in the Persian Gulf at Bushire.These papers concern the case an Egyptian schoolteacher resident in Bahrain named Muḥammad ‘Alī (alias Sayyid Aḥmad) who is accused of the assault and wrongful restraint of a small boy in the unauthorised school that he was running in Manamah. There are details regarding his background, including his employment with the British Government as a junior clerk in Iraq; and activities in Bahrain are given, including his possible role in tensions between Sunni and Shiah communities of Manamah; and his proposed deportation.
